result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jarrell D'Angelo Knight

records.addlTxt: 10:36 AM Defendant Jarrell D'Angelo Knight appeared by phone.  Attorney Bradley J. Lochowicz appeared by video for Jarrell D'Angelo Knight.  Prosecuting attorney Mason C Braunschweig appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives preliminary hearing freely and voluntarily.  Court accepts waiver and binds the Defendant over for the filing of an Information. Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived. Defendants Attorney pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set.
Preliminary hearing on October 24, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Activity: Status conference

Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Status conference on October 12, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Status conference scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
